  • Familiarity with readability scores such as Flesch-Kincaid Reading Ease
  • Comfortable being in a fast-paced writing workflow with back-and-forth feedback for writers
  • Experience applying SEO best practices to web content
  • Experience writing affiliate product content
  • Excellent reliability at working a bit each day to keep on top of this fast environment

We are currently looking for an editor who will oversee the production of four to five 2,500 word articles per week. I expect this will be a 5-8 hour a week commitment and may grow as needed.

Three samples of your own best published written content for review (the more relevant the better), a paragraph on what 'quality writing' means to you, a paragraph about why responsiveness and 'keeping on top of it' are important in the editor role, a bit about your editorial or writing experience, and your preferred rate/hour.

Profile Coach – Resume Writer at Trilogy Education Services

Remote

Location: Remote

About Trilogy:

Powered by big dreams and small egos, Trilogy is reimagining how skills-based learning can change the face of education. We work with experienced instructors, innovative employers, and top universities to create boot camps that prepare highly-motivated students for high-growth careers. And although we’ve successfully graduated hundreds of students, this is truly Day 1 for us.

Driven by a one-team mentality, were looking for those with the hunger, talent, and passion to ride this wave with us.

Trilogy is the first of its kind to bring the successful web development boot camp model in house to academic institutions while supporting the entire student academic journey. Our platform combines coding curriculum, student recruitment, and career placement services to elevate graduates for increased job market success. We are in high-growth mode and rapidly expanding our family of partners.

Our Values:

  1. We put students first: We put students first because they deserve nothing less – and our university and employer partners expect nothing less. Every aspect of Trilogy’s success depends on this.
  2. We never stop improving: We believe that continuous improvement is the source of innovation. We lend an ear to both our fans and our critics in an effort to deliver better programs, better service, better communication, and better value.
  3. We bring a ‘can do’ attitude: We are a team of entrepreneurs who confront challenges head-on and figure things out. We value action, effort, commitment, and learning.
  4. We succeed only as a team: Teamwork is critical to our success, and we place a tremendous value on how we work together in our immediate teams, between our business units, and across the entire company.

We are seeking

A well written and highly communicative Profile Coach to aid in reviewing, providing feedback and coaching and helping our students build their set of documents needed to get hired . Our students currently work with some of the best companies in the world, from startup to enterprise level: Deloitte, IBM, layer.com, CardCash and others. You will be responsible for providing feedback on and coaching for online profiles; including resumes, cover letters, social media footprint, and technical portfolio.

High-level view of who you are:

  • You love to write and read other peoples writing; and your professional writing and communication skills have been used repeatedly in either resume writing, career preparation or human resource functions.
  • You are passionate about making the world a better place through skills based education.
  • You are excited to engage with students to help create the portfolio of documents that will drive their getting a new job,

In this job you will:

  • Develop and continuously optimize templates for resumes, online portfolios and other tools used for people to get hired.
  • Work with fullstack web development students to polish their online profiles; including resumes, cover letters, social media footprint, and technical portfolio.
  • Provide consistent and appropriate feedback on career ready tools.
  • Provide insight into tech hiring requirements as they relate to a developer’s online profile.
  • Integrate feedback from employers into our online portfolio templates and test response rates.
  • Take a consultative approach and ensuring you are building students confidence while coaching them on their portfolio.
  • Maintain accurate records of activity through our CRM.
  • Communicate and coordinate with students over multiple locations as well as our internal career services team.

What makes you a great fit for this role (Requirements):

  • Professional resume writing background preferred. Those with career coaching, human resources, or technical recruiting experience will be considered
  • Exceptional writing and editing skills with impeccable attention to detail
  • The ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines
  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Word/Google Docs with a strong aptitude for formatting.
  • Certified Professional Resume Writers (CPRW) and Nationally Certified Resume Writers (NCRW) certification is preferred, but not required.
  • 2+ years of technical sourcing experience
  • Solid tech and industry knowledge with ability to understand relevant tech skills, and target companies
  • Startup experience is a plus
  • Excellent communication skills: you will need to engage through text, so strong writing skills are essential.

ClickThere, LLC is a performance marketing company led by founders who have acquired millions of customers and managed hundreds of millions of dollars in online spend. ClickThere is made up of an extremely nimble team bringing together world class talent to scale customer acquisition in highly competitive verticals for leading online companies.

As our Content Manager/Editor you will:

  • Recruit, train, and manage freelance writers on our multiple website properties to generate high quality, memorable, and useful content
  • Create and enforce a style guide for each website property and likewise ensure all content matches
  • Edit posts, find and utilize photos, and push the publish button
  • Research and create new topic ideas with a focus on increasing our SEO
  • Design and implement a content calendar for each of our properties
  • Work with our in house designer and team to create interactive infographics, video, and other highly linkable and shareable content
  • Work with our third party SEO link building firms to create highly linkable content with a focus on increasing our organic rankings
  • Stay on top of the latest content marketing trends to ensure our websites and content fit the needs of our audiences
  • Writing some content yourself is welcomed and encouraged!
  • Never utter the words, That’s not my job.

Helpful Skills & Experience

  • You must have experience in editing and writing content for websites with a high amount of SEO traffic
  • You must have experience in managing multiple freelancers
  • You must know how to research and write SEO keyword focused copy, headlines, descriptions, and alt text
  • You must be able to write kick-butt content yourself in the absence of freelancers
  • You should know basic HTML so that you can ensure all posts/content/copy looks and fits in to each website template
  • You must be okay taking input from various stakeholders and implementing feedback
  • You must be okay working on a variety of projects, daily
  • You must not be afraid to test new ideas, find winners, and pull back on losers
  • You must be okay with constant change – we move quickly and test often

Clear and constant communication, transparency, open-mindedness, empathy, and a desire to win are just a few of ClickThere’s cultural values. We are looking for a person who understands this culture and will thrive within a team of people passionate about self-improvement, honesty and kicking ass every single day at the office.

We want world-class talent – live and work from wherever you’re the happiest.

Be the master of your field – we encourage you to read and learn about whatever you want.

Ride a Rocket Ship

While no-one can predict the future, we can promise you the experience gained from ClickThere, LLC will be unlike anything you’ve experienced in a previous job.

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Craft thoughtful, strategic, and conversion-oriented educational and sales copy to support each step in the conversion funnel. Copy is an important piece of the entire customer lifecycle, from the acquisition stage through to the retention and referral stages. The copy you create will allow us to optimize all areas of this funnel.

  • Generate promotional messaging and sales copy to support product launches, promotions, and marketing campaigns. We have launched dozens of skus in 2018 and we’re not slowing down.

  • Ensure all copy adheres to our rigorous excellence standards. Authenticity is critical and everything we communicate to our current, past, or prospective customers must closely align with our brand voice and meet or exceed excellence bar.

  • A proven track record writing high-converting, strategic copy

  • Experience writing copy in an ecommerce environment with a deep understanding of ecommerce and the challenges and opportunities of a high growth company.

 Fitness: You get a monthly budget to invest on a gym membership, personal trainer, yoga classes, and anything else that helps you increase your physical fitness.

️  Retreats: Having fun is one of our core values. Join us on our all expenses paid retreats to fantastic locations.

We are committed to hiring individuals with a diversity of perspectives, backgrounds, and beliefs who can use their interest in health to help us build an organization that makes a difference in in the world. Algorithmia automates, optimizes, and accelerates every step of the journey to deploying AI/ML at scale. We allow anyone to run models on massively parallel infrastructure in minutes instead of months, in our cloud or your datacenter – all completely managed for maximum performance at minimum cost. Already trusted by over 70k developers and major enterprise customers, Algorithmia makes scalable Machine Learning fast, simple, and cost-effective for everyone.

Content is a key part of our growth strategy, and it’s a core element of our company’s DNA: everyone from growth to backend engineering publishes. We write twice a week on our blog, run two newsletters, produce our own enterprise funnel content, and heavily scrutinize the copy on all of our marketing materials. Here are a few of our favorite content pieces from across the web:

  • What is Data Science? (Thinkful)
  • Checkpointing Tutorial for TensorFlow, Keras, and PyTorch (FloydHub)
  • Visual Intro to Machine Learning, Part 1 (R2D3)

Impact and high-level responsibilities

Copy and communication are central to how we convey our value to the marketplace, and we’re looking for a copywriter to help streamline and own that process.

You’ll:

  • Increase the number of people that engage with our product, encouraging them to trust us and explore what we offer
  • Make sure that when practitioners and Enterprises think about deploying Machine Learning, Algorithmia comes to mind
  • Maintain and develop a vision for what high quality and engaging writing for a technical audience looks like

We’ve already built a significant content operation and rank highly for most Machine Learning keywords, but we don’t have all the answers. We’ll need you to help iterate on and create one of the industry’s best content shops.

Practical responsibilities

As Algorithmia’s copywriter, your practical responsibilities will include:

  • Owning copy, content, text, and any other methods of textual communication that Algorithmia produces (just in case new ones are invented while you’re here )
  • Producing 1-2 posts on our blog per week
  • Running and improving our weekly and monthly newsletters
  • Working with other teams on company projects that involve copy
  • Testing different messages to our target audiences
  • Develop content that moves prospects and leads through the Marketing & Sales funnel
  • Measure the success of content using out internal technologies

On a given day, you might find yourself:

  • Working with one of our Solutions Engineers to help write a training document for a customer deployment
  • Looking through Google Analytics to see how your recent blog post performed comparatively
  • Writing ad copy for the team to use as part of a new campaign
  • Pulling metrics to measure the success of content throughout the Awareness, Marketing and Sales funnel
  • We’re an early stage startup, and things are growing quickly: these responsibilities will evolve over time.

Who we’re looking for

You’ll be a good fit for this opportunity if:

  • You’re excited and energized by writing
  • You have a strong, coherent, and accessible voice that engages readers
  • You’re interested in how content gets distributed: community (Reddit, Hacker News), newsletters, etc.
  • You’re able to think about what your audience is looking for and how to fill that gap

Algorithmia is a very technical company, so you’ll need to be comfortable with understanding and writing about technical topics. We’re looking for someone with at least 3 years of demonstrable writing activity, preferably with some artifacts of technical writing. As part of your application, we’ll ask you to share 3 technical posts that you admire or like.

As a copywriter at Algorithmia, you’ll join a company that’s scaling rapidly and already has huge customer demand. You’ll solve real company problems, make an impact, and work in a flexible environment that encourages growth. You’ll be welcomed into an intelligent, quirky team and gain access to fantastic perks beyond just salary, equity, and insurance benefits – all from the comfort of (what we like to call) the best office in Seattle or wherever you want.

Content Marketing Writer

Headquarters: Barcelona
http://wildaudience.com

How is success defined for this role?

Your role will be an absolute success if you are able to write two high quality articles about marketing per week without missing a single deadline. You must understand Wild Audience’s marketing approach and you are able to quickly make sense of marketing videos created by Bastian and use them to write your masterpieces.

Outcomes/Responsibilities:

1. You listen to Wild Audience FM interviews (https://wildaudience.com/fm/) where Bastian (CEO) interviews companies like Buffer and HubSpot and marketers like Rand Fishkin or Todd Brown. You quickly grasp the marketing concepts discussed in the interviews.
2. You create article outlines based on WA podcast episodes to plan article structures. You work together with WA’s editor to create a perfect article structure.
3. You write the first and second draft of the article and use your editor’s feedback to improve your article.
4. You enhance your article by doing your own research via Google to find relevant graphics, statistics and link out to third party articles and our own WA articles.
5. You are able to adapt to the Wild Audience voice and ghostwrite for Bastian.
6. You incorporate essential SEO practises (optimized titles, keywords, internal linking, content variation..) into your articles. The keyword research has been done for you already.
7. You create a content upgrade for your articles with the goal to get 10% of article readers to sign-up for the content upgrade.
8. You are able to write 2 articles (around 2000 words per article) per week

Job Description:

1. This is a freelancer role with no fixed amount of hours. You design your job & amount of time that is required to achieve the results that are expected from you
2. Wild Audience & you agree on a budget per article and you get paid per article delivered
3. This role can be remote or if desired, you can be part of Wild Audience’s core team in Barcelona. You can also work remote and join us for a few weeks/months in Barcelona if you’re a digital nomad. If you are located in Barcelona long-term or short-term (for example for a few months):
  • We do team lunches pretty much every day together at the aticco roof terrace with a 360 view over Barcelona and the ocean. We would love you to bring your own food (either cook it yourself or buy it) and join us at the terrace. We usually talk about surfing, traveling, Wild Audience etc..
  • We would love you to join our weekly Tuesday beach morning fitness (fitness+swimming+meditation)
  • Bastian and the WA team enjoy a very healthy way of living. Bastian likes to do sports 3 times a week and eats completely vegan. It's important to him and the WA culture that you respect these values but they are - of course - completely optional.
4. Wild Audience’s editor checks in with you on a bi-weekly basis where you guys talk about your performance, your challenges & goals. He will coach & help you as much as possible on a personal & professional level
5. You are confident with working remotely and communicating via Zoom Video Rooms, Asana, Google Drive & Slack

We’re a team of 14 on a mission to help companies build amazing products. We’re growing quickly and hiring to support our growth. Over 1,000 innovative companies – including tech giants like Spotify, Pinterest, Vistaprint, and Adobe – rely on the User Interviews platform to support their UX, design, and product development process. Join us today to help us influence the next several generations of products.

Job Description

User Interviews is looking for a junior level content crafter to join the marketing team (of 2!). The ideal candidate has a strong interest in UX and product design in general, and UX research in particular. Perhaps you have even worked as a designer, or do a little on the side. Your command of the English language is strong, and you geek out on Oxford comma usage. You know more words than you choose to use, because you’re trying to communicate with people, not show off.

  • Your primary role will be writing and producing content including written (blog, newsletter, Field Guide, and social) and soon-to-come formats (podcast, video). You’ll also work with contributors to help source, edit, and publish their content. You’ll pitch new ideas, topics, and formats, and help get the word out there among our growing community of UX researchers. You’ll help build that community too. A huge bonus is if you can bring some basic (or not so basic) design skills to the role too.
  • You should have a fundamental curiosity about people, their behavior and interests. Our entire company is largely built around user interviews, that is talking to users, and we try to bring this interview format to our content heavily. You need to want to talk to people, and be willing to learn something from them. You also need to understand, instinctively and through data, what makes content good: honest, compelling, and useful to our audience.
  • You should want to understand complex topics deeply, and push yourself to explain them in novel yet really approachable and unpretentious ways.

We’re a 16-person distributed team. That means you over-communicate, have a strong mastery of your own time and priorities, and are excited by the idea of joining an early-stage and lean startup.

Contact erin@userinterviews.com if this sounds like a role you’d be really excited about and send a link to your LinkedIn profile + any relevant writing samples and/or design portfolios. Note: this is a junior level role, with a target salary of $45-$60k.

User Interviews is a seed-funded startup on a mission to help companies build amazing products. Our platform makes it incredibly easy for Product Managers and UX Designers to gather feedback by talking to their users. Over 1000 companies – including tech giants like Spotify, Pinterest, Vistaprint, and Adobe – already rely on our platform to streamline their user research efforts.

11-50 Employees

items.content:
Developer Educator, Editor-in-Chief

Developer
Anywhere in US
Company: Twilio
Full Time

Overview

You’re a developer. You’ve spent at least a few years building websites or apps, and you’ve got a foundational knowledge of software development because of it.

But somewhere along the way you realized that communication is the key to any software project — specifically, written communication. You understand the power of well-written technical content, but you also know the devil is in the details: you are no stranger to the challenges of accuracy, conciseness and relevance.

Alongside your development skills. you’ve probably honed your craft as a technical writer and editor through blog posts, documentation or something similar. Along the way you developed strong relationships with the people who inform your writing, because you know effective communication with them is key to your success.

What

As Editor-in-Chief for Twilio’s technical content, you will own the strategy for Twilio’s developer content across twilio.com and our other properties.

You’ll spend a good portion of your time writing for Twilio’s developer audience yourself, but you’ll more often find yourself collaborating with other teams across Twilio as they prepare content for our developer audience.

That content could be a refreshed landing page on twilio.com, a launch package of content for a new product, or a steady stream of blog posts and documentation to help us serve a community of developers we may have overlooked.

You’ll learn about the worlds of Search Engine Optimization (SEO) and web analytics if you haven’t already. You’ll likely dive even deeper in your data analysis to help us spot opportunities to reach new developers or better serve those already in our audience.

On rare occasions, you’ll crack open your text editor and build a new feature for twilio.com when it’s necessary to support your content strategy.

Above all else, however, you’ll set the strategy for all of Twilio’s technical content and support every contributor at Twilio to be a part of it.

Why

Twilio’s mission is to fuel the future of communications.

The Developer Network is the team at Twilio whose mission is to catalyze the network of developers who will build the future of communications. The DevNet is comprised of three teams that work closely with one another. Developer Evangelists inspire and equip developers by going to the language-centric and geographic communities where developers gather. Developer Educators challenge and empower developers by crafting world-class docs and training. Community Developers encourage and amplify developers by cultivating a core community of Twilio developers. Together, these three teams introduce developers to Twilio, help them get their projects shipped and build strong end enduring friendships with them.

Twilio is a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we’re dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion and innovation that we believe only gets better when your ideas thrive.

Where

This is a remote position. You can be based in a major metro area.  While working remote you will still enjoy our incredible perks: a free Kindle when you build your Twilio app, monthly Kindle book reimbursement, monthly gym reimbursement, bi-weekly All Hands and more.  Because you will collaborate with many people in Twilio HQ, you may need to travel to our San Francisco office 1-2 times per quarter. We also believe that in order to do this job well, you need a balanced work and home life.  We offer generous PTO. What you will also get to experience is a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; that strives to balance work and home life, that understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture where everyone is able to do and be the best version of themselves. We seek people who naturally demonstrate our values, who are challenged by problems, empower others to thrive, people who can draw the owl and not be beholden to one playbook.

About us:

Community Manager

**WHAT WE DO **

The administrative profession isn’t what it used to be, and the influx of changing technologies and new responsibilities in an ever-evolving workplace has business implications beyond the front desk.

OfficeNinjas recognizes admins and workplace operators, aka “Ninjas,” for the curious, engaged, forward-thinking professionals they are. We exist to provide vital resources, educational content, vendor vetting, networking events, and industry insights to ensure they have every opportunity to lead a valued and fulfilling professional life.


**WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR **

We’re looking for a Community Manager (CM) with a distinctive voice who can champion the OfficeNinjas brand and harness the power of our global network.

The admin role is evolving, and Ninjas are leading the charge. Like all pioneers, they have big ideas and even bigger questions. The CM hears everything our community members share and eagerly responds with well-researched suggestions, a dose of encouragement, or an offer to facilitate a connection.

The ideal candidate knows how to balance their unique personality with the OfficeNinjas’ brand so that every interaction feels human and authentic. They’ve found the intersection of fun and professionalism. They live there now.

An integral member of OfficeNinjas’ fully remote team, the CM knows how to collect, synthesize, and report feedback in a way that helps our team better understand admins and anticipate their needs.

Most importantly, the person who lands this gig needs to LOVE working with people. We’re a company founded on relationships, and this job represents that. The CM must be a clear, efficient, and friendly communicator who thrives in a collaborative, remote work environment.

Feeling excited and motivated? Then you’re exactly the type of candidate we’re looking for.

**WHAT YOU DO **

Using your powers of project management, you serve as the lead contact for OfficeNinjas Think Tank, a specialized group of highly vetted Ninjas who advise our team on business development, marketing efforts, and product development.
You manage every aspect of our volunteer program, including interviewing, selecting, and training reliable event volunteers who are passionate about the OfficeNinjas community.
Through guidance, organizational support, and brand education, you nurture the OfficeNinjas Ambassadors, a motivated group of admins who help generate awareness and excitement for our content, programs, services, and events.
You do more than just moderate our social media platforms. You create spaces that are supportive and informative by encouraging conversation and providing valuable content.
Using the SOP that you create, you manage our HelpScout account, ensuring that all customer support concerns are addressed with care and efficiency.

**WHAT YOU NEED TO HAVE**

25+ hours a week to consistently dedicate to OfficeNinjas (with room to increase hours)
Two years of experience in community management, preferably for a remote team
Good understanding of the business operations/administrative role (bonus if you’ve worked as a Ninja yourself).
Ability to maintain accuracy under pressure, handle multiple projects simultaneously, and adapt quickly to rapidly shifting priorities.
A builder’s sensibility. You understand that if it doesn’t exist, it’s time to take ownership and build it with scalability in mind.
Proficiency in Asana (or similar project management tool), G Suite, and Slack.
A healthy combination of big-picture perspective and appreciation for the details.
A passion for collaboration. Your team members’ success is your success. You want everyone, yourself included, to continue to learn and grow.
An appreciation for candor. You can handle it and offer it up.
Tech savviness. You’re constantly researching new tech tools, and you think every new software system is figureoutable.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. You’re always respectful but you don’t mince words, and you get to the point in as few characters as possible.
Major chops in the problem-solving category. You’re constantly thinking ahead. And when issues do pop up, they don’t greatly impact your project’s progress or outcome.
A growth mindset. You seize opportunities to learn skills outside of your job description.


**LAST WORDS**
We mentioned we appreciate candor, so here’s a bit of OfficeNinjas realness: we work hard and smart. We launch and execute new projects every 90 days, accomplishing in three months what most businesses do in a year. We’re looking for someone who can jump in the game, pick up the ball, and run with it.

The Community Manager is a long-term role, and they will be crucial to our success and growth. They’ll champion the OfficeNinjas brand and harness the power of our global network of admins. The job comes with a ton of responsibility, but an equal amount of opportunity and even more fulfillment.

Did this job description spark a little fire and give you goosebumps? If you’re excited to apply, we would love to learn more about you!

At Amplify, we want to help our clients find those words. We even want to help them find the words for the conversations they don’t even know they need to have!

 

Are you someone that wants to help us on this mission?

 

We are looking for a couple of new people to join our team for regular content creation work.

 

This includes:

 

  •         Creating new blog and article posts of 350-500 words each and some longer form
  •         Creating social media copy
  •         Creating lead gen documents
  •         Editing existing content
  •         Creating web page content
  •         Copy for email nurture campaigns
  •         Interviewing our clients for content extraction

 

If this interests you, please fill out ‘The Become an Amplifyer’ form and include examples of sites that you have managed content for.

 

Amplify is a team of passionate and dedicated people located in 9 time zones and we are very connected with each other.

 

Communication is key, if this isn't your strength, then this role isn't for you. We prefer people in the team who have had experience working in a virtual team.

Applications without ‘The Become an Amplifyer’ form will NOT be considered.

Job Description

Job Summary
Eximchain is looking for a talented Content Writer to be part of our growing team. The successful candidate will be responsible for creating compelling blog posts, social media content, web copy and documentation that will lead to appealing to our target audience and boosting brand awareness. The responsibility includes expanding our digital footprint and driving more value through online content. The ideal candidate should be able to present a proven track record of producing pieces that increase engagement and drive targeted quality leads. This position requires a high level of creativity and the ability to use data-driven insights to write optimised materials. A candidate experienced in B2B content writing or the supply chain industry is preferred. If you are familiar with producing online content and have an eye for detail, we’d like to meet you. This position is open for remote-working.

Responsibilities

  • Research industry-related topics (combining online sources, interviews and studies)
  • Design the content strategy and curate the compelling story that applies the fast-changing industry trend in a timely manner
  • Write clear marketing copy to promote our technology/products
  • Regularly produce various content types, including email, social media posts, blogs and white papers
  • Edit content created by other members of the team
  • Schedule content publishing on time using content management tools
  • Prepare well-structured drafts using Google drive or content management tools
  • Use SEO best practices to generate traffic to our site
  • Actively manage and promote our blog, and pitch articles to relevant third-party platforms
  • Analyze content marketing metrics and makes changes as needed
  • Coordinate with marketing, product, business and tech teams to illustrate articles and to create innovative content ideas
  • Monitor the key industry issues and Eximchain related mentions online

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in English, Journalism, Marketing or related field
  • A minimum of 5 years of experience in the relevant field
  • Knowledge of digital marketing tactics, including SEO, email marketing and web analytics
  • Proven work experience as a Content Writer, Copywriter or similar role in English
  • Portfolio of published articles
  • Excellent writing skills, as well as the ability to communicate and collaborate effectively
  • Experience doing research using multiple sources
  • The ability to consistently meet tight deadlines
  • Hands-on experience with content management tools, i.e. Medium, Hootsuite, GetResponse
  • Weekly call with the relevant team members
  • At least three years of experience writing for a B2B audience
  • Experience in the supply chain industry is a plus
  • Experience in the blockchain/cryptocurrency industry is a plus
  • Remote-working experience is a plus

Negotiable
